ExtraInfoSlides.DetailText:
You can contact or connect with me through any of the above information.

I am currently 18 Years old and reside in Short Hills, NJ

Next year I am super excited to be given the opportunity to enroll in MIT, where I will most likely major in Computer Science and minor/major in finance.  I will bring my iOS development skills and hopefully find others and create a development team

I am excited for a huge variety of opportunities that MIT offers.  Currently, I am thinking of joining the MIT Rocket Team, UAV Team, and the Tech X group that organizes CS events for MIT like Hack MIT.

I am graduating from Millburn High School this June with high honors.  I challenged myself in many classes and some of my favorites were Advanced Robotics, AP Computer Science, and AP Physics B & C.  As a Math/Science guy, I almost died in AP English Language and Composition.

I started learning programming in 9th grade, when I took Computer Science 1 in Java as an elective. I absolutely loved it, so I started programming in my free time.  In 10th Grade I learned how to make apps in Objective-C and in 11th grade I went to my first hackathon.
ExtraInfoSlides.FlavorSubtext: Swift, Objective-C/C++, Java, JS, HTML, CSS

ExtraInfoSlides.DetailText: When I went to my first hackathon, I met a few nearby iOS developers in high school. Together we decided to form Isometric Studios, a team to work on freelance projects and attend hackathons. To date I worked on four different jobs with apps in categories ranging from video editing to object tracking to informative apps.

In the summer of 2014 I was an iOS intern at U.S. Squash. I built a prototype of an informational iPad app for members. This was the first large app I ever built and I learned about code organization, network connections, and the importance of design. It was my first time working in an office.
ExtraInfoSlides.FlavorSubtext:
iOS intern, U.S. Squash
Summer of 2014

ExtraInfoSlides.DetailText: In the summer of 2015 I interned again and built a scoring app scores live on the U.S. Squash website. They currently use the scoring app in the higher level sanctioned U.S. Squash Junior tournaments.  It is super satisfying playing in tournaments and seeing all of the refs use an app that I worked on.
ExtraInfoSlides.FlavorSubtext:
iOS intern, U.S. Squash
Summer of 2015

ExtraInfoSlides.DetailText: Right now I am working on a freelancing project in Swift. In terms of skills, I recently became extremely interested in UI/UX. The designs of the My Info and My Apps sections are both variations of UX animations that I found and loved on dribbble.com. Implementing them taught me lots about low level animation in iOS.
ExtraInfoSlides.FlavorSubtext:
Current: Freelance Project
Skills Developing: UI/UX
Exploring: Machine Learning
Next Languages: Haskell, Python, R

ExtraInfoSlides.DetailText: The first time I went to a hackathon I was amazed. I formed a team with complete strangers, each one of them wanting to create something amazing.
